Posts.Content: clover3 Hi, everyone i'm new to this. Writing this on my sisters behalf who was diagnosed with breast cancer back in May, because she as an active her2 she is receiving chemo before surgery and radiotherapy. The chemo she is having is FEC-T which is in two parts each part has three cycles. Tomorrow is her last one of part one, part two starts in three weeks. We have a long way to go. The reason I am sending this post is although we have other sisters and brothers, they have made it quite clear that they don't want to know (they did the same with me when I had cancer three yrs back) and she is divorced, so my point is that it's just us two, and I am struggling to keep her sprits up and to keep her thinking positive,  I think she needs words of encouragement etc from somebody other than me.  Can anyone help please.   All positive message will be gratefully received. Thank you in anticipation.  hi I am new to this also, I had had a lumpectomy in 1999 followed by chemotherapy and radiotherapy. I am still here to tell the tale, if anyone wants to hear about my journey I will gladly share. Good luck to all.xx
Posts.Title: My sister. needs postive messages from people who are in the same...

Posts.Content: Mdeb01 Hi all, I was diagnosed with breast cancer 2 1/2 months ago, I've had two ops went well!! Next week I'm starting my chemo, feeling really nervous. Worried about feeling sick, loosing my hair!!! I've got lots of support from family and friends still doesn't stop you feeling your by yourself!!  hi never think your alone ! The same road I walked in 1999, the whole world was looking for the milliuinm bugs!  I felt lost as I danced to the music and welcomed the new century! No hair , funny hats continued till February 2000. When at last chemo and rad finished I got the news I had beat the devil his toes curled for the last time !!! You never loose the dread of its return but I am determined to live and breathe the air many are not so luckily to see. Good luck on your journey. Xx
